name: Pho Hoa
address: 260C Pasteur, Ward 8, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City
history: Established in 1965, Pho Hoa is renowned for its traditional Vietnamese pho. With a reputation for serving some of the best pho in Ho Chi Minh City, this restaurant is a staple for locals and tourists alike.

name: Banh Mi Huynh Hoa
address: 26 Le Thi Rieng, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
history: Banh Mi Huynh Hoa has been serving delicious banh mi sandwiches since 1989. The shop is famous for its flavorful fillings and crispy baguettes, making it a favorite spot for a quick and tasty meal.

name: Com tam Ba Ghien
address: 198 Vo Van Tan, Ward 5, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City
history: Since 1995, Com tam Ba Ghien has been a go-to spot for com tam (broken rice). Known for its rich flavors and generous portions, it offers a variety of dishes that showcase the best of Vietnamese cuisine.

name: Quan An Ngon
address: 160 Pasteur, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
history: Quan An Ngon offers a diverse range of traditional Vietnamese dishes in a cozy setting. The restaurant prides itself on its authentic flavors and is popular among both locals and tourists.

name: Sui Cao Hoang Thao
address: 42A Ky Con, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
history: Specializing in dumplings and wontons, Sui Cao Hoang Thao has been serving its unique and flavorful dishes since 2000. The restaurant is celebrated for its delicious dim sum and attentive service.

name: Banh Xeo Tu Minh
address: 158/2A, Mau Than Street, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City
history: Banh Xeo Tu Minh is renowned for its crispy Vietnamese pancakes (banh xeo). Established in 1990, it offers a variety of fillings and accompaniments, making it a popular spot for both locals and visitors.

name: Com tam Ba Thanh
address: 72 Nguyen Trai, Cai Khe Ward, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City
history: Com tam Ba Thanh is famous for its broken rice dishes. Since 2005, the restaurant has been serving flavorful and satisfying meals that highlight the rich culinary traditions of southern Vietnam.

name: Hu Tieu My Tho
address: 35 Vo Van Tan, Tan An Ward, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City
history: Hu Tieu My Tho specializes in Hu Tieu, a noodle soup dish with roots in My Tho. Established in 2010, this eatery is celebrated for its flavorful broth and generous portions of meat and vegetables.

name: Bun Rieu Cua 10
address: 10 Le Loi, Tan An Ward, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City
history: Bun Rieu Cua 10 has been a local favorite since 2008, known for its crab-based noodle soup (bun rieu). The restaurant offers a rich and flavorful experience with its carefully prepared broth and fresh ingredients.

name: Cafe Trung Nguyên Legend
address: 125A, Hùng Vương, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City
history: Part of the renowned Trung Nguyên coffee chain, this cafe has been serving high-quality Vietnamese coffee since 2012. It offers a range of coffee drinks and light bites in a comfortable setting.

name: Pho Gia Truyen
address: 49 Bat Dan, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi
history: Pho Gia Truyen is famous for its traditional Hanoi-style pho. Established in 2000, this restaurant is known for its rich broth and tender beef, making it a must-visit for pho enthusiasts.

name: Bun Cha Huong Lien
address: 24 Le Van Huu, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi
history: Bun Cha Huong Lien, known as 'Obama Bun Cha' after President Obama's visit, serves delicious bun cha (grilled pork with rice noodles). Since 2010, it has become an iconic spot in Hanoi.

name: Cha Ca La Vong
address: 14 Cha Ca, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi
history: Cha Ca La Vong has been serving its signature cha ca (grilled fish) since 1871. This historic restaurant is renowned for its unique preparation method and flavorful dish.

name: Xoi Yen
address: 35B Nguyen Huu Huan, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi
history: Xoi Yen is well-known for its xoi (sticky rice) dishes. Operating since 1995, the restaurant offers a variety of toppings and combinations, making it a popular choice for a hearty breakfast or lunch.

name: Banh Cuon Gia Truyen
address: 26B Dong Da, Dong Da District, Hanoi
history: Banh Cuon Gia Truyen has been serving traditional Vietnamese steamed rice rolls since 1975. Known for its delicate and flavorful rolls, it is a beloved spot for authentic banh cuon.
